item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. NASA spacecraft to probe possibility of life in Europa's salty ocean (57 points | 13 comments)
2. FRED: New Zealand open-access and crowdsource database of fossil records (26 points | 4 comments)
3. Hack GPON – how to access, change and edit fibre ONTs (104 points | 52 comments)
4. Insights after 11 years with Datomic [video] (84 points | 6 comments)
5. On Impactful AI Research (172 points | 29 comments)
6. Show HN: Hosting my website using my C web server (170 points | 52 comments)
7. Furnace – the biggest multi-system chiptune tracker ever made (83 points | 19 comments)
8. Beyond the route: Introducing granular MTA bus speed data (180 points | 49 comments)
9. Launch HN: Modern Realty (YC S24) – AI Real Estate Agent for Home Buyers (132 points | 250 comments)
10. Why are the violins the biggest section in the orchestra? (43 points | 34 comments)
11. Understudied protein blobs have global effects on cell biochemistry (37 points | 8 comments)
12. The Calculator that spawned the Microprocessor (2009) (83 points | 20 comments)
13. Why Most Published Research Findings Are False (2005) (164 points | 184 comments)
14. Show HN: Velvet – Store OpenAI requests in your own DB (60 points | 30 comments)
15. Thoughts on Debugging (23 points | 14 comments)
16. A Little History of the Anchovy (38 points | 13 comments)
17. Filtered for home robots, fast and slow (17 points | 7 comments)
18. Show HN: OpenFreeMap – Open-Source Map Hosting (739 points | 205 comments)
19. GSoC'24: Differentiable Logic for Interactive Systems and Generative Music (78 points | 7 comments)
20. How We Sort the World (11 points | 2 comments)
21. Death of the Department Store (61 points | 71 comments)
22. Ask HN: Platform for 11 year old to create video games? (66 points | 81 comments)
23. Working Turing Machine (76 points | 2 comments)
24. Wasm2Mpy: Compiling WASM to MicroPython so it can run on Raspberrys (69 points | 23 comments)
25. Neat Randomized Algorithms: RandDiag for Rapidly Diagonalizing Normal Matrices (59 points | 4 comments)
26. Doom on a modified rotary phone (64 points | 21 comments)
27. Google Cache is fully dead (261 points | 150 comments)
28. Move Fast and Abandon Things (401 points | 185 comments)
29. G, a Statistical Myth (2007) (18 points | 1 comment)
30. Hacker plants false memories in ChatGPT to steal user data in perpetuity (159 points | 53 comments)
